node.title: Former lead detective reveals police bugged car of William Tyrrell's foster-parents
node.description: Gary Jubelin, who headed the police investigation for four years, says William Tyrrell's foster-parents were interrogated and placed under a covert operation that involved placing a listening device in their car before being ruled out as suspects.
node.content:
["The former lead detective in the William Tyrrell case, Gary Jubelin, has revealed that he interrogated the missing boy's foster-parents and placed a listening device in their car before they were ruled out as suspects.", "During an interview with 2GB radio, the former detective said he had interrogated, formally interviewed and released the foster-parents, with a \"covert operation running\" which involved placing a bug in their car to listen in on\u00a0their conversations.", "\"Based on the answers to those questions and also the information that we gathered during the covert operation, they were again eliminated,\" he said.", "Mr Jubelin headed the William Tyrrell investigation from early 2015 until he was removed from the case in March, 2019.", "He resigned from the police force shortly afterwards.", "", "
William Tyrrell was barefoot in photographs taken shortly before he disappeared.(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "In April 2020, he was convicted of making four illegal recordings of interviews with a person of interest in the case\u00a0and fined $10,000.", "During his radio interview, Mr Jubelin said that, when he took over the case five months after the three-year-old vanished from his foster-grandmother's house in Kendall, he was told in the handover that the foster-parents had been ruled out of any involvement.", "About 18 months into the investigation, some members of the police strike force suggested there was evidence that needed to be clarified with the foster-parents.", "Mr Jubelin said he wasn't \"overly concerned\" but wanted to make sure every angle was covered.", "That was when he formally interviewed the couple.", "\"I went hard on them,\" he said.", "One line of questioning was the foster-mother's account that William had been wearing shoes at the time of his disappearance when photographs taken shortly before showed him barefoot.", "\"The answer was that the shoes weren't on William at the time of the photo but William was capable of putting his shoes on,\" he said.", "Mr Jubelin said the conclusion reached by police\u00a0was that the foster-parents were not involved in the disappearance.", "\"At the time\u00a0I was taken off the investigation, there was absolutely no evidence that made me suspicious in regards to their involvement.\"", "", "
Gary Jubelin said the theory that William Tyrrell may have fallen from a balcony had been investigated previously.(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "Mr Jubelin said the theory that William may have died after falling from a balcony at the house in Kendall was investigated back in 2016.", "\"[We]\u00a0investigated every theory:\u00a0[He] died from an accident, whether William was run over on the driveway or fell over and hit his head on a rock or fell off the balcony.", "\"That's the most obvious place when you look at the house that a child could injure themselves.\"", "He said he couldn't recall the foster-grandmother's car, which was seized by police last week, being examined at the time.", "", "
Gary Jubelin was critical of comments made by\u00a0NSW Police Commissioner Mick Fuller.(AAP: Dan Himbrechts/James Gourley)
", "Mr Jubelin\u00a0hit back at criticism from the NSW Police Commissioner that \"time was wasted\" during the early years of the investigation, \"looking at some persons of interest that were clearly not\".", "\"What really frustrates me about that is a lack of understanding about what a homicide investigation is,\" Mr Jubelin said.", "\"Homicide is about exploring all the possibilities.\"", "He rejected claims by the Commissioner that, during his time in charge, the investigation was \"in a shambles\".", "The William Tyrrell case, he said, was the most closely monitored\u00a0investigation in New South Wales.\u00a0", "\"I did monthly reports, detailing what I was doing, what suspects I was targeting, what the future directions were.", "\"They were signed off by all my chain of command, up to assistant commissioner level, and there was not one ounce of criticism in the whole four years I ran that investigation.\"", "", "
Police scour bushland on day four of the new search for William Tyrrell.(ABC News: Claudia Jambor)
", "The former homicide-investigator-turned-media pundit warned the public against being \"armchair detectives\".", "\"Think Cleo Smith. I don't think there's anyone who sat there and didn't form an opinion when we watched that first media conference \u2026\u00a0and it turned out that we were wrong,\" he said."]
